monogr.title: Ben Sira in Conversation with Traditions: A Festschrift for Prof. Núria Calduch-Benages on the Occasion of Her 65th Birthday

biblStruct.note: The article traces the background and history of the prophetic-sapiential motif “bread to the hungry and clothes to the naked” as it appears in Tobit, the Sibylline Oracles 1–2, Pseudo-Phocylides, the Gospel of Matthew, and 2 Enoch, ultimately finding its way into the Syriac addition in Sir 29:28. It shows that the motif became central to the shared theological and ethical vision in Judaism and Christianity in the early centuries of the Common Era.
